questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A customer has requested two custom PCs, one for his family room and one for his home office. The family room PC will be used by all the family members and should be able to play high definition movies and show family pictures. The office PC is used for the customers architectural design business and should be able to handle the intensive design work and multitasking the customer performs. The office PC must be configured with more power efficient computing than the family room PC.
Instructions: Use the tabs at the top to switch between the PCs. Objects should be placed on the appropriate slot/display areas and can only be used once. All slot/display areas should be filled. Once the simulation is complete select the done button to submit.
Build PCs for the Family Room and Home Office
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: correction: *Multifunction device - Home Office, Card reader - Family room

SLI Graphics Card - Home Office
HDMI Graphics Card - Family Room
Blu-Ray Drive -Family Room
Dvd Burner Drive - Home Office
4GB Memory - Family Room
8GB Memory - Home Office
Dual Core 64-bit 3GHz CPU - Home Office
Two 64-bit 3GHz CPU - Family Room
Dual Monitor Display - Home Office
Large TV Display - Family Room
Card Reader - Home office
Multifunction Device - Family Room
The home office PC is supposed to be way more powerful than the family room PC all that's done with the Family room PC is watch movies and pictures.

questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting an expansion card in a computer that allows the computer to receive faxes over a VoIP line. The telephone line connected to the expansion card is MOST likely which of the following cable types?

discussion.content: An intrusion detection system (IDS) is a device or software application that monitors a network for malicious activity or policy violations. Any malicious activity or violation is typically reported or collected centrally using a security information and event management system.

questions.question_text: Which of the following BIOS level settings allow an administrator to view warnings on possible hardware level changes?

choices.A: Change the BIOS settings to the local time
choices.C: Attach a 220-volt power strip from the current region to the PC
choices.D: Attach a 120-volt battery backup power supply to the PC

questions.question_text: A technician arrives in Germany and discovers that when their PC is plugged into the outlet, no power is received. Which of the following actions should the technician take to get the PC to operate?
